46#define CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS 21333
47
48void
49intel_fixed_panel_mode(const struct drm_display_mode *fixed_mode,
50 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
51{
52 drm_mode_copy(adjusted_mode, fixed_mode);
53
54 drm_mode_set_crtcinfo(adjusted_mode, 0);
55}
56
57/**
58 * intel_find_panel_downclock - find the reduced downclock for LVDS in EDID
59 * @dev: drm device
60 * @fixed_mode : panel native mode
61 * @connector: LVDS/eDP connector
62 *
63 * Return downclock_avail
64 * Find the reduced downclock for LVDS/eDP in EDID.
65 */
66struct drm_display_mode *
67intel_find_panel_downclock(struct drm_device *dev,
68 struct drm_display_mode *fixed_mode,
69 struct drm_connector *connector)
70{
71 struct drm_display_mode *scan, *tmp_mode;
72 int temp_downclock;
73
74 temp_downclock = fixed_mode->clock;
75 tmp_mode = NULL;
76
77 list_for_each_entry(scan, &connector->probed_modes, head) {
78 /*
79 * If one mode has the same resolution with the fixed_panel
80 * mode while they have the different refresh rate, it means
81 * that the reduced downclock is found. In such
82 * case we can set the different FPx0/1 to dynamically select
83 * between low and high frequency.
84 */
85 if (scan->hdisplay == fixed_mode->hdisplay &&
86 scan->hsync_start == fixed_mode->hsync_start &&
87 scan->hsync_end == fixed_mode->hsync_end &&
88 scan->htotal == fixed_mode->htotal &&
89 scan->vdisplay == fixed_mode->vdisplay &&
90 scan->vsync_start == fixed_mode->vsync_start &&
91 scan->vsync_end == fixed_mode->vsync_end &&
92 scan->vtotal == fixed_mode->vtotal) {
93 if (scan->clock < temp_downclock) {
94 /*
95 * The downclock is already found. But we
96 * expect to find the lower downclock.
97 */
98 temp_downclock = scan->clock;
99 tmp_mode = scan;
100 }
101 }
102 }
103
104 if (temp_downclock < fixed_mode->clock)
105 return drm_mode_duplicate(dev, tmp_mode);
106 else
107 return NULL;
108}
109
110/* adjusted_mode has been preset to be the panel's fixed mode */
111void
112intel_pch_panel_fitting(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
113 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config,
114 int fitting_mode)
115{
116 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode;
117 int x = 0, y = 0, width = 0, height = 0;
118
119 /* Native modes don't need fitting */
120 if (adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay == pipe_config->pipe_src_w &&
121 adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay == pipe_config->pipe_src_h)
122 goto done;
123
124 switch (fitting_mode) {
125 case DRM_MODE_SCALE_CENTER:
126 width = pipe_config->pipe_src_w;
127 height = pipe_config->pipe_src_h;
128 x = (adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay - width + 1)/2;
129 y = (adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay - height + 1)/2;
130 break;
131
132 case DRM_MODE_SCALE_ASPECT:
133 /* Scale but preserve the aspect ratio */
134 {
135 u32 scaled_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay
136 * pipe_config->pipe_src_h;
137 u32 scaled_height = pipe_config->pipe_src_w
138 * adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay;
139 if (scaled_width > scaled_height) { /* pillar */
140 width = scaled_height / pipe_config->pipe_src_h;
141 if (width & 1)
142 width++;
143 x = (adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay - width + 1) / 2;
144 y = 0;
145 height = adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay;
146 } else if (scaled_width < scaled_height) { /* letter */
147 height = scaled_width / pipe_config->pipe_src_w;
148 if (height & 1)
149 height++;
150 y = (adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay - height + 1) / 2;
151 x = 0;
152 width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay;
153 } else {
154 x = y = 0;
155 width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay;
156 height = adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay;
157 }
158 }
159 break;
160
161 case DRM_MODE_SCALE_FULLSCREEN:
162 x = y = 0;
163 width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay;
164 height = adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay;
165 break;
166
167 default:
168 WARN(1, "bad panel fit mode: %d\n", fitting_mode);
169 return;
170 }
171
172done:
173 pipe_config->pch_pfit.pos = (x << 16) | y;
174 pipe_config->pch_pfit.size = (width << 16) | height;
175 pipe_config->pch_pfit.enabled = pipe_config->pch_pfit.size != 0;
176}
177
178static void
179centre_horizontally(struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode,
180 int width)
181{
182 u32 border, sync_pos, blank_width, sync_width;
183
184 /* keep the hsync and hblank widths constant */
185 sync_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hsync_end - adjusted_mode->crtc_hsync_start;
186 blank_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hblank_end - adjusted_mode->crtc_hblank_start;
187 sync_pos = (blank_width - sync_width + 1) / 2;
188
189 border = (adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay - width + 1) / 2;
190 border += border & 1; /* make the border even */
191
192 adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay = width;
193 adjusted_mode->crtc_hblank_start = width + border;
194 adjusted_mode->crtc_hblank_end = adjusted_mode->crtc_hblank_start + blank_width;
195
196 adjusted_mode->crtc_hsync_start = adjusted_mode->crtc_hblank_start + sync_pos;
197 adjusted_mode->crtc_hsync_end = adjusted_mode->crtc_hsync_start + sync_width;
198}
199
200static void
201centre_vertically(struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode,
202 int height)
203{
204 u32 border, sync_pos, blank_width, sync_width;
205
206 /* keep the vsync and vblank widths constant */
207 sync_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_vsync_end - adjusted_mode->crtc_vsync_start;
208 blank_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_vblank_end - adjusted_mode->crtc_vblank_start;
209 sync_pos = (blank_width - sync_width + 1) / 2;
210
211 border = (adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay - height + 1) / 2;
212
213 adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay = height;
214 adjusted_mode->crtc_vblank_start = height + border;
215 adjusted_mode->crtc_vblank_end = adjusted_mode->crtc_vblank_start + blank_width;
216
217 adjusted_mode->crtc_vsync_start = adjusted_mode->crtc_vblank_start + sync_pos;
218 adjusted_mode->crtc_vsync_end = adjusted_mode->crtc_vsync_start + sync_width;
219}
220
221static inline u32 panel_fitter_scaling(u32 source, u32 target)
222{
223 /*
224 * Floating point operation is not supported. So the FACTOR
225 * is defined, which can avoid the floating point computation
226 * when calculating the panel ratio.
227 */
228#define ACCURACY 12
229#define FACTOR (1 << ACCURACY)
230 u32 ratio = source * FACTOR / target;
231 return (FACTOR * ratio + FACTOR/2) / FACTOR;
232}
233
234static void i965_scale_aspect(struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config,
235 u32 *pfit_control)
236{
237 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode;
238 u32 scaled_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay *
239 pipe_config->pipe_src_h;
240 u32 scaled_height = pipe_config->pipe_src_w *
241 adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay;
242
243 /* 965+ is easy, it does everything in hw */
244 if (scaled_width > scaled_height)
245 *pfit_control |= PFIT_ENABLE |
246 PFIT_SCALING_PILLAR;
247 else if (scaled_width < scaled_height)
248 *pfit_control |= PFIT_ENABLE |
249 PFIT_SCALING_LETTER;
250 else if (adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay != pipe_config->pipe_src_w)
251 *pfit_control |= PFIT_ENABLE | PFIT_SCALING_AUTO;
252}
253
254static void i9xx_scale_aspect(struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config,
255 u32 *pfit_control, u32 *pfit_pgm_ratios,
256 u32 *border)
257{
258 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode;
259 u32 scaled_width = adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay *
260 pipe_config->pipe_src_h;
261 u32 scaled_height = pipe_config->pipe_src_w *
262 adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay;
263 u32 bits;
264
265 /*
266 * For earlier chips we have to calculate the scaling
267 * ratio by hand and program it into the
268 * PFIT_PGM_RATIO register
269 */
270 if (scaled_width > scaled_height) { /* pillar */
271 centre_horizontally(adjusted_mode,
272 scaled_height /
273 pipe_config->pipe_src_h);
274
275 *border = LVDS_BORDER_ENABLE;
276 if (pipe_config->pipe_src_h != adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay) {
277 bits = panel_fitter_scaling(pipe_config->pipe_src_h,
278 adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay);
279
280 *pfit_pgm_ratios |= (bits << PFIT_HORIZ_SCALE_SHIFT |
281 bits << PFIT_VERT_SCALE_SHIFT);
282 *pfit_control |= (PFIT_ENABLE |
283 VERT_INTERP_BILINEAR |
284 HORIZ_INTERP_BILINEAR);
285 }
286 } else if (scaled_width < scaled_height) { /* letter */
287 centre_vertically(adjusted_mode,
288 scaled_width /
289 pipe_config->pipe_src_w);
290
291 *border = LVDS_BORDER_ENABLE;
292 if (pipe_config->pipe_src_w != adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay) {
293 bits = panel_fitter_scaling(pipe_config->pipe_src_w,
294 adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay);
295
296 *pfit_pgm_ratios |= (bits << PFIT_HORIZ_SCALE_SHIFT |
297 bits << PFIT_VERT_SCALE_SHIFT);
298 *pfit_control |= (PFIT_ENABLE |
299 VERT_INTERP_BILINEAR |
300 HORIZ_INTERP_BILINEAR);
301 }
302 } else {
303 /* Aspects match, Let hw scale both directions */
304 *pfit_control |= (PFIT_ENABLE |
305 VERT_AUTO_SCALE | HORIZ_AUTO_SCALE |
306 VERT_INTERP_BILINEAR |
307 HORIZ_INTERP_BILINEAR);
308 }
309}
310
311void intel_gmch_panel_fitting(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
312 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config,
313 int fitting_mode)
314{
315 struct drm_device *dev = intel_crtc->base.dev;
316 u32 pfit_control = 0, pfit_pgm_ratios = 0, border = 0;
317 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode;
318
319 /* Native modes don't need fitting */
320 if (adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay == pipe_config->pipe_src_w &&
321 adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay == pipe_config->pipe_src_h)
322 goto out;
323
324 switch (fitting_mode) {
325 case DRM_MODE_SCALE_CENTER:
326 /*
327 * For centered modes, we have to calculate border widths &
328 * heights and modify the values programmed into the CRTC.
329 */
330 centre_horizontally(adjusted_mode, pipe_config->pipe_src_w);
331 centre_vertically(adjusted_mode, pipe_config->pipe_src_h);
332 border = LVDS_BORDER_ENABLE;
333 break;
334 case DRM_MODE_SCALE_ASPECT:
335 /* Scale but preserve the aspect ratio */
336 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
337 i965_scale_aspect(pipe_config, &pfit_control);
338 else
339 i9xx_scale_aspect(pipe_config, &pfit_control,
340 &pfit_pgm_ratios, &border);
341 break;
342 case DRM_MODE_SCALE_FULLSCREEN:
343 /*
344 * Full scaling, even if it changes the aspect ratio.
345 * Fortunately this is all done for us in hw.
346 */
347 if (pipe_config->pipe_src_h != adjusted_mode->crtc_vdisplay ||
348 pipe_config->pipe_src_w != adjusted_mode->crtc_hdisplay) {
349 pfit_control |= PFIT_ENABLE;
350 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
351 pfit_control |= PFIT_SCALING_AUTO;
352 else
353 pfit_control |= (VERT_AUTO_SCALE |
354 VERT_INTERP_BILINEAR |
355 HORIZ_AUTO_SCALE |
356 HORIZ_INTERP_BILINEAR);
357 }
358 break;
359 default:
360 WARN(1, "bad panel fit mode: %d\n", fitting_mode);
361 return;
362 }
363
364 /* 965+ wants fuzzy fitting */
365 /* FIXME: handle multiple panels by failing gracefully */
366 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
367 pfit_control |= ((intel_crtc->pipe << PFIT_PIPE_SHIFT) |
368 PFIT_FILTER_FUZZY);
369
370out:
371 if ((pfit_control & PFIT_ENABLE) == 0) {
372 pfit_control = 0;
373 pfit_pgm_ratios = 0;
374 }
375
376 /* Make sure pre-965 set dither correctly for 18bpp panels. */
377 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 4 && pipe_config->pipe_bpp == 18)
378 pfit_control |= PANEL_8TO6_DITHER_ENABLE;
379
380 pipe_config->gmch_pfit.control = pfit_control;
381 pipe_config->gmch_pfit.pgm_ratios = pfit_pgm_ratios;
382 pipe_config->gmch_pfit.lvds_border_bits = border;
383}
384
385enum drm_connector_status
386intel_panel_detect(struct drm_device *dev)
387{
388 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
389
390 /* Assume that the BIOS does not lie through the OpRegion... */
391 if (!i915.panel_ignore_lid && dev_priv->opregion.lid_state) {
392 return *dev_priv->opregion.lid_state & 0x1 ?
393 connector_status_connected :
394 connector_status_disconnected;
395 }
396
397 switch (i915.panel_ignore_lid) {
398 case -2:
399 return connector_status_connected;
400 case -1:
401 return connector_status_disconnected;
402 default:
403 return connector_status_unknown;
404 }
405}
406
407/**
408 * scale - scale values from one range to another
409 *
410 * @source_val: value in range [@source_min..@source_max]
411 *
412 * Return @source_val in range [@source_min..@source_max] scaled to range
413 * [@target_min..@target_max].
414 */
415static uint32_t scale(uint32_t source_val,
416 uint32_t source_min, uint32_t source_max,
417 uint32_t target_min, uint32_t target_max)
418{
419 uint64_t target_val;
420
421 WARN_ON(source_min > source_max);
422 WARN_ON(target_min > target_max);
423
424 /* defensive */
425 source_val = clamp(source_val, source_min, source_max);
426
427 /* avoid overflows */
428 target_val = DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST_ULL((uint64_t)(source_val - source_min) *
429 (target_max - target_min), source_max - source_min);
430 target_val += target_min;
431
432 return target_val;
433}
434
435#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE)
436/* Scale user_level in range [0..user_max] to [hw_min..hw_max]. */
437static inline u32 scale_user_to_hw(struct intel_connector *connector,
438 u32 user_level, u32 user_max)
439{
440 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
441
442 return scale(user_level, 0, user_max,
443 panel->backlight.min, panel->backlight.max);
444}
445#endif
446
447/* Scale user_level in range [0..user_max] to [0..hw_max], clamping the result
448 * to [hw_min..hw_max]. */
449static inline u32 clamp_user_to_hw(struct intel_connector *connector,
450 u32 user_level, u32 user_max)
451{
452 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
453 u32 hw_level;
454
455 hw_level = scale(user_level, 0, user_max, 0, panel->backlight.max);
456 hw_level = clamp(hw_level, panel->backlight.min, panel->backlight.max);
457
458 return hw_level;
459}
460
461#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE)
462/* Scale hw_level in range [hw_min..hw_max] to [0..user_max]. */
463static inline u32 scale_hw_to_user(struct intel_connector *connector,
464 u32 hw_level, u32 user_max)
465{
466 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
467
468 return scale(hw_level, panel->backlight.min, panel->backlight.max,
469 0, user_max);
470}
471#endif
472
473static u32 intel_panel_compute_brightness(struct intel_connector *connector,
474 u32 val)
475{
476 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
477 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
478 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
479
480 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
481
482 if (i915.invert_brightness < 0)
483 return val;
484
485 if (i915.invert_brightness > 0 ||
486 dev_priv->quirks & QUIRK_INVERT_BRIGHTNESS) {
487 return panel->backlight.max - val;
488 }
489
490 return val;
491}
492
493static u32 lpt_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
494{
495 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
496 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
497
498 return I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2) & BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
499}
500
501static u32 pch_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
502{
503 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
504 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
505
506 return I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL) & BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
507}
508
509static u32 i9xx_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
510{
511 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
512 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
513 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
514 u32 val;
515
516 val = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL) & BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
517 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 4)
518 val >>= 1;
519
520 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode) {
521 u8 lbpc;
522
523 pci_read_config_byte(dev->pdev, PCI_LBPC, &lbpc);
524 val *= lbpc;
525 }
526
527 return val;
528}
529
530static u32 _vlv_get_backlight(struct drm_device *dev, enum i915_pipe pipe)
531{
532 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
533
534 if (WARN_ON(pipe != PIPE_A && pipe != PIPE_B))
535 return 0;
536
537 return I915_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL(pipe)) & BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
538}
539
540static u32 vlv_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
541{
542 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
543 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
544
545 return _vlv_get_backlight(dev, pipe);
546}
547
548static u32 bxt_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
549{
550 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
551 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
552 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
553
554 return I915_READ(BXT_BLC_PWM_DUTY(panel->backlight.controller));
555}
556
557#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX mipi */
558static u32 pwm_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
559{
560 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
561 int duty_ns;
562
563 duty_ns = pwm_get_duty_cycle(panel->backlight.pwm);
564 return DIV_ROUND_UP(duty_ns * 100, CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS);
565}
566#endif
567
568#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE)
569static u32 intel_panel_get_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
570{
571 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
572 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
573 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
574 u32 val = 0;
575
576 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
577
578 if (panel->backlight.enabled) {
579 val = panel->backlight.get(connector);
580 val = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
581 }
582
583 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
584
585 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("get backlight PWM = %d\n", val);
586 return val;
587}
588#endif
589
590static void lpt_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
591{
592 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
593 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
594 u32 val = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2) & ~BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
595 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2, val | level);
596}
597
598static void pch_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
599{
600 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
601 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
602 u32 tmp;
603
604 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL) & ~BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
605 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL, tmp | level);
606}
607
608static void i9xx_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
609{
610 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
611 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
612 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
613 u32 tmp, mask;
614
615 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
616
617 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode) {
618 u8 lbpc;
619
620 lbpc = level * 0xfe / panel->backlight.max + 1;
621 level /= lbpc;
622 pci_write_config_byte(dev->pdev, PCI_LBPC, lbpc);
623 }
624
625 if (IS_GEN4(dev)) {
626 mask = BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
627 } else {
628 level <<= 1;
629 mask = BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK_PNV;
630 }
631
632 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL) & ~mask;
633 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL, tmp | level);
634}
635
636static void vlv_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
637{
638 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
639 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
640 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
641 u32 tmp;
642
643 if (WARN_ON(pipe != PIPE_A && pipe != PIPE_B))
644 return;
645
646 tmp = I915_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL(pipe)) & ~BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK;
647 I915_WRITE(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL(pipe), tmp | level);
648}
649
650static void bxt_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
651{
652 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
653 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
654 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
655
656 I915_WRITE(BXT_BLC_PWM_DUTY(panel->backlight.controller), level);
657}
658
659#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX mipi */
660static void pwm_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
661{
662 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
663 int duty_ns = DIV_ROUND_UP(level * CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS, 100);
664
665 pwm_config(panel->backlight.pwm, duty_ns, CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS);
666}
667#endif
668
669static void
670intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 level)
671{
672 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
673
674 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("set backlight PWM = %d\n", level);
675
676 level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, level);
677 panel->backlight.set(connector, level);
678}
679
680#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE)
681/* set backlight brightness to level in range [0..max], scaling wrt hw min */
682static void intel_panel_set_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector,
683 u32 user_level, u32 user_max)
684{
685 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
686 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
687 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
688 u32 hw_level;
689
690 if (!panel->backlight.present)
691 return;
692
693 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
694
695 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
696
697 hw_level = scale_user_to_hw(connector, user_level, user_max);
698 panel->backlight.level = hw_level;
699
700 if (panel->backlight.enabled)
701 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, hw_level);
702
703 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
704}
705#endif
706
707/* set backlight brightness to level in range [0..max], assuming hw min is
708 * respected.
709 */
710void intel_panel_set_backlight_acpi(struct intel_connector *connector,
711 u32 user_level, u32 user_max)
712{
713 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
714 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
715 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
716 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
717 u32 hw_level;
718
719 /*
720 * INVALID_PIPE may occur during driver init because
721 * connection_mutex isn't held across the entire backlight
722 * setup + modeset readout, and the BIOS can issue the
723 * requests at any time.
724 */
725 if (!panel->backlight.present || pipe == INVALID_PIPE)
726 return;
727
728 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
729
730 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
731
732 hw_level = clamp_user_to_hw(connector, user_level, user_max);
733 panel->backlight.level = hw_level;
734
735#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX backlight */
736 if (panel->backlight.device)
737 panel->backlight.device->props.brightness =
738 scale_hw_to_user(connector,
739 panel->backlight.level,
740 panel->backlight.device->props.max_brightness);
741#endif
742
743 if (panel->backlight.enabled)
744 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, hw_level);
745
746 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
747}
748
749static void lpt_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
750{
751 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
752 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
753 u32 tmp;
754
755 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, 0);
756
757 /*
758 * Although we don't support or enable CPU PWM with LPT/SPT based
759 * systems, it may have been enabled prior to loading the
760 * driver. Disable to avoid warnings on LCPLL disable.
761 *
762 * This needs rework if we need to add support for CPU PWM on PCH split
763 * platforms.
764 */
765 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2);
766 if (tmp & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) {
767 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("cpu backlight was enabled, disabling\n");
768 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2, tmp & ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
769 }
770
771 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
772 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, tmp & ~BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE);
773}
774
775static void pch_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
776{
777 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
778 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
779 u32 tmp;
780
781 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, 0);
782
783 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2);
784 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2, tmp & ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
785
786 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
787 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, tmp & ~BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE);
788}
789
790static void i9xx_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
791{
792 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, 0);
793}
794
795static void i965_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
796{
797 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
798 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
799 u32 tmp;
800
801 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, 0);
802
803 tmp = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL2);
804 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL2, tmp & ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
805}
806
807static void vlv_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
808{
809 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
810 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
811 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
812 u32 tmp;
813
814 if (WARN_ON(pipe != PIPE_A && pipe != PIPE_B))
815 return;
816
817 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, 0);
818
819 tmp = I915_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe));
820 I915_WRITE(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe), tmp & ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
821}
822
823static void bxt_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
824{
825 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
826 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
827 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
828 u32 tmp, val;
829
830 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, 0);
831
832 tmp = I915_READ(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller));
833 I915_WRITE(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller),
834 tmp & ~BXT_BLC_PWM_ENABLE);
835
836 if (panel->backlight.controller == 1) {
837 val = I915_READ(UTIL_PIN_CTL);
838 val &= ~UTIL_PIN_ENABLE;
839 I915_WRITE(UTIL_PIN_CTL, val);
840 }
841}
842
843#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX mipi */
844static void pwm_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
845{
846 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
847
848 /* Disable the backlight */
849 pwm_config(panel->backlight.pwm, 0, CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS);
850 usleep_range(2000, 3000);
851 pwm_disable(panel->backlight.pwm);
852}
853#endif
854
855void intel_panel_disable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
856{
857 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
858 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
859 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
860
861 if (!panel->backlight.present)
862 return;
863
864 /*
865 * Do not disable backlight on the vga_switcheroo path. When switching
866 * away from i915, the other client may depend on i915 to handle the
867 * backlight. This will leave the backlight on unnecessarily when
868 * another client is not activated.
869 */
870 if (dev->switch_power_state == DRM_SWITCH_POWER_CHANGING) {
871 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Skipping backlight disable on vga switch\n");
872 return;
873 }
874
875 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
876
877#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX backlight */
878 if (panel->backlight.device)
879 panel->backlight.device->props.power = FB_BLANK_POWERDOWN;
880#endif
881 panel->backlight.enabled = false;
882 panel->backlight.disable(connector);
883
884 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
885}
886
887static void lpt_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
888{
889 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
890 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
891 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
892 u32 pch_ctl1, pch_ctl2;
893
894 pch_ctl1 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
895 if (pch_ctl1 & BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE) {
896 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pch backlight already enabled\n");
897 pch_ctl1 &= ~BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE;
898 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, pch_ctl1);
899 }
900
901 pch_ctl2 = panel->backlight.max << 16;
902 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2, pch_ctl2);
903
904 pch_ctl1 = 0;
905 if (panel->backlight.active_low_pwm)
906 pch_ctl1 |= BLM_PCH_POLARITY;
907
908 /* After LPT, override is the default. */
909 if (HAS_PCH_LPT(dev_priv))
910 pch_ctl1 |= BLM_PCH_OVERRIDE_ENABLE;
911
912 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, pch_ctl1);
913 POSTING_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
914 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, pch_ctl1 | BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE);
915
916 /* This won't stick until the above enable. */
917 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
918}
919
920static void pch_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
921{
922 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
923 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
924 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
925 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
926 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder =
927 intel_pipe_to_cpu_transcoder(dev_priv, pipe);
928 u32 cpu_ctl2, pch_ctl1, pch_ctl2;
929
930 cpu_ctl2 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2);
931 if (cpu_ctl2 & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) {
932 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("cpu backlight already enabled\n");
933 cpu_ctl2 &= ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE;
934 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2, cpu_ctl2);
935 }
936
937 pch_ctl1 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
938 if (pch_ctl1 & BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE) {
939 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pch backlight already enabled\n");
940 pch_ctl1 &= ~BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE;
941 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, pch_ctl1);
942 }
943
944 if (cpu_transcoder == TRANSCODER_EDP)
945 cpu_ctl2 = BLM_TRANSCODER_EDP;
946 else
947 cpu_ctl2 = BLM_PIPE(cpu_transcoder);
948 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2, cpu_ctl2);
949 POSTING_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2);
950 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2, cpu_ctl2 | BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
951
952 /* This won't stick until the above enable. */
953 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
954
955 pch_ctl2 = panel->backlight.max << 16;
956 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2, pch_ctl2);
957
958 pch_ctl1 = 0;
959 if (panel->backlight.active_low_pwm)
960 pch_ctl1 |= BLM_PCH_POLARITY;
961
962 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, pch_ctl1);
963 POSTING_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
964 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1, pch_ctl1 | BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE);
965}
966
967static void i9xx_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
968{
969 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
970 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
971 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
972 u32 ctl, freq;
973
974 ctl = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL);
975 if (ctl & BACKLIGHT_DUTY_CYCLE_MASK_PNV) {
976 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight already enabled\n");
977 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL, 0);
978 }
979
980 freq = panel->backlight.max;
981 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode)
982 freq /= 0xff;
983
984 ctl = freq << 17;
985 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode)
986 ctl |= BLM_LEGACY_MODE;
987 if (IS_PINEVIEW(dev) && panel->backlight.active_low_pwm)
988 ctl |= BLM_POLARITY_PNV;
989
990 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL, ctl);
991 POSTING_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL);
992
993 /* XXX: combine this into above write? */
994 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
995
996 /*
997 * Needed to enable backlight on some 855gm models. BLC_HIST_CTL is
998 * 855gm only, but checking for gen2 is safe, as 855gm is the only gen2
999 * that has backlight.
1000 */
1001 if (IS_GEN2(dev))
1002 I915_WRITE(BLC_HIST_CTL, BLM_HISTOGRAM_ENABLE);
1003}
1004
1005static void i965_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
1006{
1007 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1008 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1009 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1010 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
1011 u32 ctl, ctl2, freq;
1012
1013 ctl2 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL2);
1014 if (ctl2 & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) {
1015 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight already enabled\n");
1016 ctl2 &= ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE;
1017 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL2, ctl2);
1018 }
1019
1020 freq = panel->backlight.max;
1021 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode)
1022 freq /= 0xff;
1023
1024 ctl = freq << 16;
1025 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL, ctl);
1026
1027 ctl2 = BLM_PIPE(pipe);
1028 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode)
1029 ctl2 |= BLM_COMBINATION_MODE;
1030 if (panel->backlight.active_low_pwm)
1031 ctl2 |= BLM_POLARITY_I965;
1032 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL2, ctl2);
1033 POSTING_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL2);
1034 I915_WRITE(BLC_PWM_CTL2, ctl2 | BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
1035
1036 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
1037}
1038
1039static void vlv_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
1040{
1041 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1042 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1043 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1044 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
1045 u32 ctl, ctl2;
1046
1047 if (WARN_ON(pipe != PIPE_A && pipe != PIPE_B))
1048 return;
1049
1050 ctl2 = I915_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe));
1051 if (ctl2 & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) {
1052 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight already enabled\n");
1053 ctl2 &= ~BLM_PWM_ENABLE;
1054 I915_WRITE(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe), ctl2);
1055 }
1056
1057 ctl = panel->backlight.max << 16;
1058 I915_WRITE(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL(pipe), ctl);
1059
1060 /* XXX: combine this into above write? */
1061 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
1062
1063 ctl2 = 0;
1064 if (panel->backlight.active_low_pwm)
1065 ctl2 |= BLM_POLARITY_I965;
1066 I915_WRITE(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe), ctl2);
1067 POSTING_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe));
1068 I915_WRITE(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe), ctl2 | BLM_PWM_ENABLE);
1069}
1070
1071static void bxt_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
1072{
1073 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1074 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1075 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1076 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
1077 u32 pwm_ctl, val;
1078
1079 /* To use 2nd set of backlight registers, utility pin has to be
1080 * enabled with PWM mode.
1081 * The field should only be changed when the utility pin is disabled
1082 */
1083 if (panel->backlight.controller == 1) {
1084 val = I915_READ(UTIL_PIN_CTL);
1085 if (val & UTIL_PIN_ENABLE) {
1086 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("util pin already enabled\n");
1087 val &= ~UTIL_PIN_ENABLE;
1088 I915_WRITE(UTIL_PIN_CTL, val);
1089 }
1090
1091 val = 0;
1092 if (panel->backlight.util_pin_active_low)
1093 val |= UTIL_PIN_POLARITY;
1094 I915_WRITE(UTIL_PIN_CTL, val | UTIL_PIN_PIPE(pipe) |
1095 UTIL_PIN_MODE_PWM | UTIL_PIN_ENABLE);
1096 }
1097
1098 pwm_ctl = I915_READ(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller));
1099 if (pwm_ctl & BXT_BLC_PWM_ENABLE) {
1100 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight already enabled\n");
1101 pwm_ctl &= ~BXT_BLC_PWM_ENABLE;
1102 I915_WRITE(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller),
1103 pwm_ctl);
1104 }
1105
1106 I915_WRITE(BXT_BLC_PWM_FREQ(panel->backlight.controller),
1107 panel->backlight.max);
1108
1109 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
1110
1111 pwm_ctl = 0;
1112 if (panel->backlight.active_low_pwm)
1113 pwm_ctl |= BXT_BLC_PWM_POLARITY;
1114
1115 I915_WRITE(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller), pwm_ctl);
1116 POSTING_READ(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller));
1117 I915_WRITE(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller),
1118 pwm_ctl | BXT_BLC_PWM_ENABLE);
1119}
1120
1121#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX mipi */
1122static void pwm_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
1123{
1124 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1125
1126 pwm_enable(panel->backlight.pwm);
1127 intel_panel_actually_set_backlight(connector, panel->backlight.level);
1128}
1129#endif
1130
1131void intel_panel_enable_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector)
1132{
1133 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1134 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1135 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1136 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_get_pipe_from_connector(connector);
1137
1138 if (!panel->backlight.present)
1139 return;
1140
1141 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pipe %c\n", pipe_name(pipe));
1142
1143 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
1144
1145 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
1146
1147 if (panel->backlight.level <= panel->backlight.min) {
1148 panel->backlight.level = panel->backlight.max;
1149#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX backlight */
1150 if (panel->backlight.device)
1151 panel->backlight.device->props.brightness =
1152 scale_hw_to_user(connector,
1153 panel->backlight.level,
1154 panel->backlight.device->props.max_brightness);
1155#endif
1156 }
1157
1158 panel->backlight.enable(connector);
1159 panel->backlight.enabled = true;
1160#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX backlight */
1161 if (panel->backlight.device)
1162 panel->backlight.device->props.power = FB_BLANK_UNBLANK;
1163#endif
1164
1165 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
1166}
1167
1168#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE)
1169static int intel_backlight_device_update_status(struct backlight_device *bd)
1170{
1171 struct intel_connector *connector = bl_get_data(bd);
1172 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1173 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1174
1175 drm_modeset_lock(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex, NULL);
1176 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("updating intel_backlight, brightness=%d/%d\n",
1177 bd->props.brightness, bd->props.max_brightness);
1178 intel_panel_set_backlight(connector, bd->props.brightness,
1179 bd->props.max_brightness);
1180
1181 /*
1182 * Allow flipping bl_power as a sub-state of enabled. Sadly the
1183 * backlight class device does not make it easy to to differentiate
1184 * between callbacks for brightness and bl_power, so our backlight_power
1185 * callback needs to take this into account.
1186 */
1187 if (panel->backlight.enabled) {
1188 if (panel->backlight.power) {
1189 bool enable = bd->props.power == FB_BLANK_UNBLANK &&
1190 bd->props.brightness != 0;
1191 panel->backlight.power(connector, enable);
1192 }
1193 } else {
1194 bd->props.power = FB_BLANK_POWERDOWN;
1195 }
1196
1197 drm_modeset_unlock(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex);
1198 return 0;
1199}
1200
1201static int intel_backlight_device_get_brightness(struct backlight_device *bd)
1202{
1203 struct intel_connector *connector = bl_get_data(bd);
1204 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1205 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1206 u32 hw_level;
1207 int ret;
1208
1209 intel_runtime_pm_get(dev_priv);
1210 drm_modeset_lock(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex, NULL);
1211
1212 hw_level = intel_panel_get_backlight(connector);
1213 ret = scale_hw_to_user(connector, hw_level, bd->props.max_brightness);
1214
1215 drm_modeset_unlock(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex);
1216 intel_runtime_pm_put(dev_priv);
1217
1218 return ret;
1219}
1220
1221static const struct backlight_ops intel_backlight_device_ops = {
1222 .update_status = intel_backlight_device_update_status,
1223 .get_brightness = intel_backlight_device_get_brightness,
1224};
1225
1226static int intel_backlight_device_register(struct intel_connector *connector)
1227{
1228 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1229 struct backlight_properties props;
1230
1231 if (WARN_ON(panel->backlight.device))
1232 return -ENODEV;
1233
1234 if (!panel->backlight.present)
1235 return 0;
1236
1237 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
1238
1239 memset(&props, 0, sizeof(props));
1240 props.type = BACKLIGHT_RAW;
1241
1242 /*
1243 * Note: Everything should work even if the backlight device max
1244 * presented to the userspace is arbitrarily chosen.
1245 */
1246 props.max_brightness = panel->backlight.max;
1247 props.brightness = scale_hw_to_user(connector,
1248 panel->backlight.level,
1249 props.max_brightness);
1250
1251 if (panel->backlight.enabled)
1252 props.power = FB_BLANK_UNBLANK;
1253 else
1254 props.power = FB_BLANK_POWERDOWN;
1255
1256 /*
1257 * Note: using the same name independent of the connector prevents
1258 * registration of multiple backlight devices in the driver.
1259 */
1260 panel->backlight.device =
1261 backlight_device_register("intel_backlight",
1262 connector->base.kdev,
1263 connector,
1264 &intel_backlight_device_ops, &props);
1265
1266 if (IS_ERR(panel->backlight.device)) {
1267 DRM_ERROR("Failed to register backlight: %ld\n",
1268 PTR_ERR(panel->backlight.device));
1269 panel->backlight.device = NULL;
1270 return -ENODEV;
1271 }
1272
1273 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Connector %s backlight sysfs interface registered\n",
1274 connector->base.name);
1275
1276 return 0;
1277}
1278
1279static void intel_backlight_device_unregister(struct intel_connector *connector)
1280{
1281 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1282
1283 if (panel->backlight.device) {
1284 backlight_device_unregister(panel->backlight.device);
1285 panel->backlight.device = NULL;
1286 }
1287}
1288#else /* CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE */
1289static int intel_backlight_device_register(struct intel_connector *connector)
1290{
1291 return 0;
1292}
1293static void intel_backlight_device_unregister(struct intel_connector *connector)
1294{
1295}
1296#endif /* CONFIG_BACKLIGHT_CLASS_DEVICE */
1297
1298/*
1299 * SPT: This value represents the period of the PWM stream in clock periods
1300 * multiplied by 16 (default increment) or 128 (alternate increment selected in
1301 * SCHICKEN_1 bit 0). PWM clock is 24 MHz.
1302 */
1303static u32 spt_hz_to_pwm(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 pwm_freq_hz)
1304{
1305 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1306 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1307 u32 mul, clock;
1308
1309 if (I915_READ(SOUTH_CHICKEN1) & SPT_PWM_GRANULARITY)
1310 mul = 128;
1311 else
1312 mul = 16;
1313
1314 clock = MHz(24);
1315
1316 return clock / (pwm_freq_hz * mul);
1317}
1318
1319/*
1320 * LPT: This value represents the period of the PWM stream in clock periods
1321 * multiplied by 128 (default increment) or 16 (alternate increment, selected in
1322 * LPT SOUTH_CHICKEN2 register bit 5).
1323 */
1324static u32 lpt_hz_to_pwm(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 pwm_freq_hz)
1325{
1326 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1327 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1328 u32 mul, clock;
1329
1330 if (I915_READ(SOUTH_CHICKEN2) & LPT_PWM_GRANULARITY)
1331 mul = 16;
1332 else
1333 mul = 128;
1334
1335 if (dev_priv->pch_id == INTEL_PCH_LPT_DEVICE_ID_TYPE)
1336 clock = MHz(135); /* LPT:H */
1337 else
1338 clock = MHz(24); /* LPT:LP */
1339
1340 return clock / (pwm_freq_hz * mul);
1341}
1342
1343/*
1344 * ILK/SNB/IVB: This value represents the period of the PWM stream in PCH
1345 * display raw clocks multiplied by 128.
1346 */
1347static u32 pch_hz_to_pwm(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 pwm_freq_hz)
1348{
1349 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1350 int clock = MHz(intel_pch_rawclk(dev));
1351
1352 return clock / (pwm_freq_hz * 128);
1353}
1354
1355/*
1356 * Gen2: This field determines the number of time base events (display core
1357 * clock frequency/32) in total for a complete cycle of modulated backlight
1358 * control.
1359 *
1360 * Gen3: A time base event equals the display core clock ([DevPNV] HRAW clock)
1361 * divided by 32.
1362 */
1363static u32 i9xx_hz_to_pwm(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 pwm_freq_hz)
1364{
1365 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1366 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1367 int clock;
1368
1369 if (IS_PINEVIEW(dev))
1370 clock = intel_hrawclk(dev);
1371 else
1372 clock = 1000 * dev_priv->display.get_display_clock_speed(dev);
1373
1374 return clock / (pwm_freq_hz * 32);
1375}
1376
1377/*
1378 * Gen4: This value represents the period of the PWM stream in display core
1379 * clocks multiplied by 128.
1380 */
1381static u32 i965_hz_to_pwm(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 pwm_freq_hz)
1382{
1383 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1384 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1385 int clock = 1000 * dev_priv->display.get_display_clock_speed(dev);
1386
1387 return clock / (pwm_freq_hz * 128);
1388}
1389
1390/*
1391 * VLV: This value represents the period of the PWM stream in display core
1392 * clocks ([DevCTG] 200MHz HRAW clocks) multiplied by 128 or 25MHz S0IX clocks
1393 * multiplied by 16. CHV uses a 19.2MHz S0IX clock.
1394 */
1395static u32 vlv_hz_to_pwm(struct intel_connector *connector, u32 pwm_freq_hz)
1396{
1397 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1398 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1399 int clock;
1400
1401 if ((I915_READ(CBR1_VLV) & CBR_PWM_CLOCK_MUX_SELECT) == 0) {
1402 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev))
1403 return KHz(19200) / (pwm_freq_hz * 16);
1404 else
1405 return MHz(25) / (pwm_freq_hz * 16);
1406 } else {
1407 clock = intel_hrawclk(dev);
1408 return MHz(clock) / (pwm_freq_hz * 128);
1409 }
1410}
1411
1412static u32 get_backlight_max_vbt(struct intel_connector *connector)
1413{
1414 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1415 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1416 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1417 u16 pwm_freq_hz = dev_priv->vbt.backlight.pwm_freq_hz;
1418 u32 pwm;
1419
1420 if (!pwm_freq_hz) {
1421 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight frequency not specified in VBT\n");
1422 return 0;
1423 }
1424
1425 if (!panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm) {
1426 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight frequency setting from VBT currently not supported on this platform\n");
1427 return 0;
1428 }
1429
1430 pwm = panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm(connector, pwm_freq_hz);
1431 if (!pwm) {
1432 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight frequency conversion failed\n");
1433 return 0;
1434 }
1435
1436 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("backlight frequency %u Hz from VBT\n", pwm_freq_hz);
1437
1438 return pwm;
1439}
1440
1441/*
1442 * Note: The setup hooks can't assume pipe is set!
1443 */
1444static u32 get_backlight_min_vbt(struct intel_connector *connector)
1445{
1446 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1447 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1448 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1449 int min;
1450
1451 WARN_ON(panel->backlight.max == 0);
1452
1453 /*
1454 * XXX: If the vbt value is 255, it makes min equal to max, which leads
1455 * to problems. There are such machines out there. Either our
1456 * interpretation is wrong or the vbt has bogus data. Or both. Safeguard
1457 * against this by letting the minimum be at most (arbitrarily chosen)
1458 * 25% of the max.
1459 */
1460 min = clamp_t(int, dev_priv->vbt.backlight.min_brightness, 0, 64);
1461 if (min != dev_priv->vbt.backlight.min_brightness) {
1462 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("clamping VBT min backlight %d/255 to %d/255\n",
1463 dev_priv->vbt.backlight.min_brightness, min);
1464 }
1465
1466 /* vbt value is a coefficient in range [0..255] */
1467 return scale(min, 0, 255, 0, panel->backlight.max);
1468}
1469
1470static int lpt_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe unused)
1471{
1472 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1473 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1474 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1475 u32 pch_ctl1, pch_ctl2, val;
1476
1477 pch_ctl1 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
1478 panel->backlight.active_low_pwm = pch_ctl1 & BLM_PCH_POLARITY;
1479
1480 pch_ctl2 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2);
1481 panel->backlight.max = pch_ctl2 >> 16;
1482
1483 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1484 panel->backlight.max = get_backlight_max_vbt(connector);
1485
1486 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1487 return -ENODEV;
1488
1489 panel->backlight.min = get_backlight_min_vbt(connector);
1490
1491 val = lpt_get_backlight(connector);
1492 panel->backlight.level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
1493
1494 panel->backlight.enabled = (pch_ctl1 & BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE) &&
1495 panel->backlight.level != 0;
1496
1497 return 0;
1498}
1499
1500static int pch_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe unused)
1501{
1502 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1503 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1504 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1505 u32 cpu_ctl2, pch_ctl1, pch_ctl2, val;
1506
1507 pch_ctl1 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL1);
1508 panel->backlight.active_low_pwm = pch_ctl1 & BLM_PCH_POLARITY;
1509
1510 pch_ctl2 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_PCH_CTL2);
1511 panel->backlight.max = pch_ctl2 >> 16;
1512
1513 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1514 panel->backlight.max = get_backlight_max_vbt(connector);
1515
1516 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1517 return -ENODEV;
1518
1519 panel->backlight.min = get_backlight_min_vbt(connector);
1520
1521 val = pch_get_backlight(connector);
1522 panel->backlight.level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
1523
1524 cpu_ctl2 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CPU_CTL2);
1525 panel->backlight.enabled = (cpu_ctl2 & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) &&
1526 (pch_ctl1 & BLM_PCH_PWM_ENABLE) && panel->backlight.level != 0;
1527
1528 return 0;
1529}
1530
1531static int i9xx_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe unused)
1532{
1533 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1534 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1535 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1536 u32 ctl, val;
1537
1538 ctl = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL);
1539
1540 if (IS_GEN2(dev) || IS_I915GM(dev) || IS_I945GM(dev))
1541 panel->backlight.combination_mode = ctl & BLM_LEGACY_MODE;
1542
1543 if (IS_PINEVIEW(dev))
1544 panel->backlight.active_low_pwm = ctl & BLM_POLARITY_PNV;
1545
1546 panel->backlight.max = ctl >> 17;
1547
1548 if (!panel->backlight.max) {
1549 panel->backlight.max = get_backlight_max_vbt(connector);
1550 panel->backlight.max >>= 1;
1551 }
1552
1553 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1554 return -ENODEV;
1555
1556 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode)
1557 panel->backlight.max *= 0xff;
1558
1559 panel->backlight.min = get_backlight_min_vbt(connector);
1560
1561 val = i9xx_get_backlight(connector);
1562 panel->backlight.level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
1563
1564 panel->backlight.enabled = panel->backlight.level != 0;
1565
1566 return 0;
1567}
1568
1569static int i965_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe unused)
1570{
1571 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1572 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1573 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1574 u32 ctl, ctl2, val;
1575
1576 ctl2 = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL2);
1577 panel->backlight.combination_mode = ctl2 & BLM_COMBINATION_MODE;
1578 panel->backlight.active_low_pwm = ctl2 & BLM_POLARITY_I965;
1579
1580 ctl = I915_READ(BLC_PWM_CTL);
1581 panel->backlight.max = ctl >> 16;
1582
1583 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1584 panel->backlight.max = get_backlight_max_vbt(connector);
1585
1586 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1587 return -ENODEV;
1588
1589 if (panel->backlight.combination_mode)
1590 panel->backlight.max *= 0xff;
1591
1592 panel->backlight.min = get_backlight_min_vbt(connector);
1593
1594 val = i9xx_get_backlight(connector);
1595 panel->backlight.level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
1596
1597 panel->backlight.enabled = (ctl2 & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) &&
1598 panel->backlight.level != 0;
1599
1600 return 0;
1601}
1602
1603static int vlv_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe pipe)
1604{
1605 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1606 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1607 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1608 u32 ctl, ctl2, val;
1609
1610 if (WARN_ON(pipe != PIPE_A && pipe != PIPE_B))
1611 return -ENODEV;
1612
1613 ctl2 = I915_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL2(pipe));
1614 panel->backlight.active_low_pwm = ctl2 & BLM_POLARITY_I965;
1615
1616 ctl = I915_READ(VLV_BLC_PWM_CTL(pipe));
1617 panel->backlight.max = ctl >> 16;
1618
1619 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1620 panel->backlight.max = get_backlight_max_vbt(connector);
1621
1622 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1623 return -ENODEV;
1624
1625 panel->backlight.min = get_backlight_min_vbt(connector);
1626
1627 val = _vlv_get_backlight(dev, pipe);
1628 panel->backlight.level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
1629
1630 panel->backlight.enabled = (ctl2 & BLM_PWM_ENABLE) &&
1631 panel->backlight.level != 0;
1632
1633 return 0;
1634}
1635
1636static int
1637bxt_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe unused)
1638{
1639 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1640 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1641 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1642 u32 pwm_ctl, val;
1643
1644 /*
1645 * For BXT hard coding the Backlight controller to 0.
1646 * TODO : Read the controller value from VBT and generalize
1647 */
1648 panel->backlight.controller = 0;
1649
1650 pwm_ctl = I915_READ(BXT_BLC_PWM_CTL(panel->backlight.controller));
1651
1652 /* Keeping the check if controller 1 is to be programmed.
1653 * This will come into affect once the VBT parsing
1654 * is fixed for controller selection, and controller 1 is used
1655 * for a prticular display configuration.
1656 */
1657 if (panel->backlight.controller == 1) {
1658 val = I915_READ(UTIL_PIN_CTL);
1659 panel->backlight.util_pin_active_low =
1660 val & UTIL_PIN_POLARITY;
1661 }
1662
1663 panel->backlight.active_low_pwm = pwm_ctl & BXT_BLC_PWM_POLARITY;
1664 panel->backlight.max =
1665 I915_READ(BXT_BLC_PWM_FREQ(panel->backlight.controller));
1666
1667 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1668 panel->backlight.max = get_backlight_max_vbt(connector);
1669
1670 if (!panel->backlight.max)
1671 return -ENODEV;
1672
1673 val = bxt_get_backlight(connector);
1674 panel->backlight.level = intel_panel_compute_brightness(connector, val);
1675
1676 panel->backlight.enabled = (pwm_ctl & BXT_BLC_PWM_ENABLE) &&
1677 panel->backlight.level != 0;
1678
1679 return 0;
1680}
1681
1682#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX mipi */
1683static int pwm_setup_backlight(struct intel_connector *connector,
1684 enum i915_pipe pipe)
1685{
1686 struct drm_device *dev = connector->base.dev;
1687 struct intel_panel *panel = &connector->panel;
1688 int retval;
1689
1690 /* Get the PWM chip for backlight control */
1691 panel->backlight.pwm = pwm_get(dev->dev, "pwm_backlight");
1692 if (IS_ERR(panel->backlight.pwm)) {
1693 DRM_ERROR("Failed to own the pwm chip\n");
1694 panel->backlight.pwm = NULL;
1695 return -ENODEV;
1696 }
1697
1698 retval = pwm_config(panel->backlight.pwm, CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS,
1699 CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS);
1700 if (retval < 0) {
1701 DRM_ERROR("Failed to configure the pwm chip\n");
1702 pwm_put(panel->backlight.pwm);
1703 panel->backlight.pwm = NULL;
1704 return retval;
1705 }
1706
1707 panel->backlight.min = 0; /* 0% */
1708 panel->backlight.max = 100; /* 100% */
1709 panel->backlight.level = DIV_ROUND_UP(
1710 pwm_get_duty_cycle(panel->backlight.pwm) * 100,
1711 CRC_PMIC_PWM_PERIOD_NS);
1712 panel->backlight.enabled = panel->backlight.level != 0;
1713
1714 return 0;
1715}
1716#endif
1717
1718int intel_panel_setup_backlight(struct drm_connector *connector, enum i915_pipe pipe)
1719{
1720 struct drm_device *dev = connector->dev;
1721 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1722 struct intel_connector *intel_connector = to_intel_connector(connector);
1723 struct intel_panel *panel = &intel_connector->panel;
1724 int ret;
1725
1726 if (!dev_priv->vbt.backlight.present) {
1727 if (dev_priv->quirks & QUIRK_BACKLIGHT_PRESENT) {
1728 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no backlight present per VBT, but present per quirk\n");
1729 } else {
1730 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no backlight present per VBT\n");
1731 return 0;
1732 }
1733 }
1734
1735 /* ensure intel_panel has been initialized first */
1736 if (WARN_ON(!panel->backlight.setup))
1737 return -ENODEV;
1738
1739 /* set level and max in panel struct */
1740 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
1741 ret = panel->backlight.setup(intel_connector, pipe);
1742 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->backlight_lock);
1743
1744 if (ret) {
1745 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("failed to setup backlight for connector %s\n",
1746 connector->name);
1747 return ret;
1748 }
1749
1750 panel->backlight.present = true;
1751
1752 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Connector %s backlight initialized, %s, brightness %u/%u\n",
1753 connector->name,
1754 panel->backlight.enabled ? "enabled" : "disabled",
1755 panel->backlight.level, panel->backlight.max);
1756
1757 return 0;
1758}
1759
1760void intel_panel_destroy_backlight(struct drm_connector *connector)
1761{
1762 struct intel_connector *intel_connector = to_intel_connector(connector);
1763 struct intel_panel *panel = &intel_connector->panel;
1764
1765#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX mipi */
1766 /* dispose of the pwm */
1767 if (panel->backlight.pwm)
1768 pwm_put(panel->backlight.pwm);
1769#endif
1770
1771 panel->backlight.present = false;
1772}
1773
1774/* Set up chip specific backlight functions */
1775static void
1776intel_panel_init_backlight_funcs(struct intel_panel *panel)
1777{
1778 struct intel_connector *intel_connector =
1779 container_of(panel, struct intel_connector, panel);
1780 struct drm_device *dev = intel_connector->base.dev;
1781 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1782
1783 if (IS_BROXTON(dev)) {
1784 panel->backlight.setup = bxt_setup_backlight;
1785 panel->backlight.enable = bxt_enable_backlight;
1786 panel->backlight.disable = bxt_disable_backlight;
1787 panel->backlight.set = bxt_set_backlight;
1788 panel->backlight.get = bxt_get_backlight;
1789 } else if (HAS_PCH_LPT(dev) || HAS_PCH_SPT(dev) ||
1790 HAS_PCH_KBP(dev)) {
1791 panel->backlight.setup = lpt_setup_backlight;
1792 panel->backlight.enable = lpt_enable_backlight;
1793 panel->backlight.disable = lpt_disable_backlight;
1794 panel->backlight.set = lpt_set_backlight;
1795 panel->backlight.get = lpt_get_backlight;
1796 if (HAS_PCH_LPT(dev))
1797 panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm = lpt_hz_to_pwm;
1798 else
1799 panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm = spt_hz_to_pwm;
1800 } else if (HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev)) {
1801 panel->backlight.setup = pch_setup_backlight;
1802 panel->backlight.enable = pch_enable_backlight;
1803 panel->backlight.disable = pch_disable_backlight;
1804 panel->backlight.set = pch_set_backlight;
1805 panel->backlight.get = pch_get_backlight;
1806 panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm = pch_hz_to_pwm;
1807 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
1808 if (dev_priv->vbt.has_mipi) {
1809#ifdef __NetBSD__
1810 panic("no muppets supported, sorry");
1811#else
1812 panel->backlight.setup = pwm_setup_backlight;
1813 panel->backlight.enable = pwm_enable_backlight;
1814 panel->backlight.disable = pwm_disable_backlight;
1815 panel->backlight.set = pwm_set_backlight;
1816 panel->backlight.get = pwm_get_backlight;
1817#endif
1818 } else {
1819 panel->backlight.setup = vlv_setup_backlight;
1820 panel->backlight.enable = vlv_enable_backlight;
1821 panel->backlight.disable = vlv_disable_backlight;
1822 panel->backlight.set = vlv_set_backlight;
1823 panel->backlight.get = vlv_get_backlight;
1824 panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm = vlv_hz_to_pwm;
1825 }
1826 } else if (IS_GEN4(dev)) {
1827 panel->backlight.setup = i965_setup_backlight;
1828 panel->backlight.enable = i965_enable_backlight;
1829 panel->backlight.disable = i965_disable_backlight;
1830 panel->backlight.set = i9xx_set_backlight;
1831 panel->backlight.get = i9xx_get_backlight;
1832 panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm = i965_hz_to_pwm;
1833 } else {
1834 panel->backlight.setup = i9xx_setup_backlight;
1835 panel->backlight.enable = i9xx_enable_backlight;
1836 panel->backlight.disable = i9xx_disable_backlight;
1837 panel->backlight.set = i9xx_set_backlight;
1838 panel->backlight.get = i9xx_get_backlight;
1839 panel->backlight.hz_to_pwm = i9xx_hz_to_pwm;
1840 }
1841}
1842
1843int intel_panel_init(struct intel_panel *panel,
1844 struct drm_display_mode *fixed_mode,
1845 struct drm_display_mode *downclock_mode)
1846{
1847 intel_panel_init_backlight_funcs(panel);
1848
1849 panel->fixed_mode = fixed_mode;
1850 panel->downclock_mode = downclock_mode;
1851
1852 return 0;
1853}
1854
1855void intel_panel_fini(struct intel_panel *panel)
1856{
1857 struct intel_connector *intel_connector =
1858 container_of(panel, struct intel_connector, panel);
1859
1860 if (panel->fixed_mode)
1861 drm_mode_destroy(intel_connector->base.dev, panel->fixed_mode);
1862
1863 if (panel->downclock_mode)
1864 drm_mode_destroy(intel_connector->base.dev,
1865 panel->downclock_mode);
1866}
1867
1868void intel_backlight_register(struct drm_device *dev)
1869{
1870 struct intel_connector *connector;
1871
1872 list_for_each_entry(connector, &dev->mode_config.connector_list, base.head)
1873 intel_backlight_device_register(connector);
1874}
1875
1876void intel_backlight_unregister(struct drm_device *dev)
1877{
1878 struct intel_connector *connector;
1879
1880 list_for_each_entry(connector, &dev->mode_config.connector_list, base.head)
1881 intel_backlight_device_unregister(connector);
1882}
